title: If you ever see a link for a Easter Event, Riot point give away... DON'T CLICK IT
body:
Alot of people I know have recently been sending me links about a "Riot easter point event" either intentionally or via having their accounts compromised by a bot. Regardless I think this is something that needs to be known should people not realize it but this is a SCAM.

I have been playing league for quite some time and cannot remember a time when Riot has done a free RP event for sharing something as simple as a code. There are also multiple signs that this is an unofficial, not Riot supported page.

**1) The footer for the fake site does not contain the same information or structure that is used by Riot.**
Riot Forum footer:
https://i.gyazo.com/ee45fa2a4d8144c6d15f1434ed9ff3e8.png

Riot home page footer:
https://i.gyazo.com/ee45fa2a4d8144c6d15f1434ed9ff3e8.png

And here is the footer for the "events" page:
https://gyazo.com/da171e50c24fb72523f5484584f9220b

Obviously there is a bunch of information missing, images, links and even a google ad. Which you will never see on a Riot page.

**2) completely obvious but the URL's are different, Riot web pages always begin with the same structure.
**For example "http://region.leagueoflegends.com/en/..." for example the URL for the Project skin page is "http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/site/skins-project/".

For obvious reasons I won't share the full link to the scam riot points page but the start of it begins with "http://riotpoints..."

**3) If you ever open the link up on mobile (which I hope you don't) you will notice that the site does not scale.**
It is not responsive aside from the header which even then does not collapse the navigation. This is rather big (for me anyway as a designer) since Riot imo does a very nice job on making every aspect of their website to respond well to screen size changes.

**4) Lastly, every link takes you to EUW.**
If you happen to click on any of the links after visiting, which I advise against. You will see every region link goes to EUW by default.

I don't know if this will help people, I would like to assume many of you probably know that this is a scam but there are probably still many people who are gullible and will click and share this to get free Riot points.


Good luck on the Rift and stay safe!

replies.body:
Thanks for helping to keep community safe!  This information has some good steps for keeping an eye out for suspicious or malicious content.  To supplement, I also recommend cautious players to look over the [Emails From Riot ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751784-Emails-from-Riot-Games)guide in case of unfamiliar emails.  I also recommend using the [account protection](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664-Protecting-Your-Account) guide to help make sure account information inside and out of league are secure.  

If you see a friend that might be accessed by an unauthorized user, be sure to let them know so they can work towards securing their account as well as any recovery.  Good stuff!
